description: This course is a service/learning experience. Week one is spent on campus learning basic clinical techniques, examining emerging disease, and studying existing health care issues. Students spend three weeks in Peru, assessing patient needs in a public hospital, a homeless shelter, orphanages, and a small village. Week four involves discussion and writing reflective journals. Offered during Interim. Apply through International and Off-Campus Studies. Prerequisites: BIO 143 or BIO 150, and BIO 291.
name: Peruvian Medical Experience
notes: You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad under its course title.
This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: BIO 143 or BIO 150, and BIO 291.
